com.rcsexample.basnlib

Interface BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataProvider, MainActivity, SettingsActivity
    Enclosing class:
    BluetoothConnectionService

    public static interface BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener
    Classes that implement this interface and register as a listener will have the callback methods called. See the method comment for a description of their functionality.
    See Also:
    BluetoothConnectionService.registerListener(BluetoothConnectionListener), onBluetoothConnectionConnected(String, String), onBluetoothConnectionFailure(int), onBluetoothConnectionReceive(byte[], int), onBluetoothConnectionStateChanged(int), onBluetoothConnectionWrite(byte[])

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onBluetoothConnectionConnected(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String address)
      This method gets called when a bluetooth connection is successfully established.
      void onBluetoothConnectionFailure(int whatFailed)
      This method gets called when a connection error occurs.
      void onBluetoothConnectionReceive(byte[] buffer, int numberOfBytesInBuffer)
      When there is (raw) data received over RFCOMM, it will be available through this function.
      void onBluetoothConnectionStateChanged(int state)
      This method gets called after the state of the bluetooth connection changed.
      void onBluetoothConnectionWrite(byte[] buffer)
      When you send something to the device (for example, by using the BluetoothConnectionService.write(byte[]) method), this method gets called with the data you sent.

    • Method Detail

      • onBluetoothConnectionStateChanged

        void onBluetoothConnectionStateChanged(int state)
        This method gets called after the state of the bluetooth connection changed.
        Parameters:
        state - The new connection state
        See Also:
        BluetoothConnectionService.STATE_NONE, BluetoothConnectionService.STATE_CONNECTING, BluetoothConnectionService.STATE_CONNECTED

      • onBluetoothConnectionConnected

        void onBluetoothConnectionConnected(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String address)
        This method gets called when a bluetooth connection is successfully established.
        Parameters:
        name - The friendly name of the remote device
        address - Its address

      • onBluetoothConnectionReceive

        void onBluetoothConnectionReceive(byte[] buffer,
                                int numberOfBytesInBuffer)
        When there is (raw) data received over RFCOMM, it will be available through this function.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer that holds the received (raw) data
        numberOfBytesInBuffer - The number of valid bytes in that buffer

      • onBluetoothConnectionWrite

        void onBluetoothConnectionWrite(byte[] buffer)
        When you send something to the device (for example, by using the BluetoothConnectionService.write(byte[]) method), this method gets called with the data you sent.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The data sent

      • onBluetoothConnectionFailure

        void onBluetoothConnectionFailure(int whatFailed)
        This method gets called when a connection error occurs.
        Parameters:
        whatFailed - Tells you what error occured
        See Also:
        BluetoothConnectionService.FAILURE_CONNECTING_FAILED, BluetoothConnectionService.FAILURE_CONNECTION_LOST, BluetoothConnectionService.FAILURE_WRITE_FAILED
